Schedule

This is a tentative schedule for the course, subject to change. Readings (in bold) refer to the corresponding units in the Knowledge Base.

Date Topics & Reading Activities Lab due Lab out
Week 1
Jan 5 Getting started with COSC 50; Linux shell and commands
Reading: "Welcome to CS50!" thru "The first remote access to a computer"		 Hello Linux! Lab 0
Jan 7 Linux file system and commands (& Teams!); Linux shell programming (bash)
Reading: "Standard input and output" thru "Origin of 'Artificial Intelligence'"		 Billboard 100, Shell games Lab 0 Lab 1
Week 2
Jan 12 Git and Github; Intro to C Programming
Reading: "Git concepts and commands" thru "Programming languages"		 Gittin' around, C ya!
Jan 14 Intro to C Programming; Memory, pointers, and scope
Reading: "C - types" thru "Why do we call it a 'core dump'?"		 MadLibs, Memory games Lab 1 Lab 2
Week 3
Jan 19 MLK Day (no class!)
Jan 21 Pointers, strings, structs, and linked lists; Modular data structures
Reading: "C - arrays of pointers and more" thru "Binary trees in C"; "Modular data structures in C"		 Structs and pointers, Let's get modular Lab 2
Week 4
Jan 26 Note: we will use x-hour on this day!
Iterators, cohesion, coupling, & design; Debugging with gdb and Valgrind
Reading: "Iterators" thru "Cohesion and coupling"; "Debugging techniques and 'gdb'" thru "Valgrind, for debugging memory errors"		 Cohesive or just sticky?, Squashing bugs with gdb, Valgrind it?
Jan 28 Makefiles; Libraries
Reading: "Modules and Makefiles" thru "Lab3 file module"; "Building and using libraries with Makefiles"		 Can you make it?, Let's make a lib Lab 3
Week 5
Feb 2 IO and memory allocation; Testing: unit, module, & system
Reading: "Testing and debugging" thru "Examples of famous bugs"		 io_and_stack, Can you break it?
Feb 4 TinySearchEngine: Crawler design; Design methodology
Reading: "Searching the Web" thru "More tips about coding"		 Fifty clouds of grey Lab 3 Lab 4
Week 6
Feb 9 IO and memory allocation (continued); Stack, heap, memory corruption
Reading: TBD		 io_and_stack (2)
Feb 11 TinySearchEngine: Indexer design; Fuzz testing
Reading: "Indexer design" thru "Fuzz testing and other techniques"		 Use the Fuzz, Luke! Lab 4 Lab 5
Week 7
Feb 16 Git Flow
Reading: "Protecting the main branc" thru "nCurses"		 Git with the Flow
Feb 18 TinySearchEngine: Querier design; Expression parsing
Reading: "Querier parsing: expressions" thru "Teamwork"		 Lab 5 Lab 6
